error.signature: Warning: Each child in a list should have a unique 'key' prop
error.regex: Each child in a list should have a unique.*key.*prop

verdict.summary: React needs unique keys on list elements for efficient reconciliation.

dead_ends.why_fails: Different key every render; React recreates all DOM nodes every time

dead_ends.action: Using array index as key with reorderable lists
dead_ends.why_fails: Index keys cause bugs when items are reordered, deleted, or inserted

workarounds.action: Use a stable unique identifier from the data: key={item.id}
workarounds.how: Database IDs, UUIDs, or other stable identifiers are ideal

workarounds.action: Index keys are OK if the list is static (never reordered/filtered): key={index}
workarounds.how: Only use index when the list is display-only and items never change order

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'Warning' indicates missing unique keys in a list, while 'Cannot destructure property 'X' of useContext(...) as it is null/undefined' indicates a useContext call outside its Provider.
'Warning' indicates missing unique keys in a list, while 'Module not found' indicates a missing react-dom/client import.
